body_html: I have the same problem with you@Xyza1972 , when using "tf.train.init_from_checkpoint" I found that the ckpt file has two types ,if the ckpt file is only one file like xxx.ckpt ,it can work well . But when the ckpt split to three files like "model.ckpt-xxx.data、model.ckpt-xxx.index、model.ckpt-xxx.meta", the problem would appear, for detail , it will restore the ckpt weights over and over again when a new epoch starts, which can not lead to a right way to get a perfect accuracy . Is that a bug or i missed something ?? Thanks for helping me .
body_text: I have the same problem with you@Xyza1972 , when using "tf.train.init_from_checkpoint"  I found that the ckpt file has two types ,if the ckpt file is only one file like xxx.ckpt ,it can work well . But when the ckpt split to three files like "model.ckpt-xxx.data、model.ckpt-xxx.index、model.ckpt-xxx.meta", the problem would appear, for detail , it will restore the ckpt weights over and over again when a new epoch starts, which can not lead to a right way to get a perfect accuracy . Is that a bug or i missed something ?? Thanks for helping me .
body: I have the same problem with you@Xyza1972 , when using "tf.train.init_from_checkpoint"  I found that the ckpt file has two types ,if the ckpt file is only one file like xxx.ckpt ,it can work well . But when the ckpt split to three files like "model.ckpt-xxx.data、model.ckpt-xxx.index、model.ckpt-xxx.meta", the problem would appear, for detail , it will restore the ckpt weights over and over again when a new epoch starts, which can not lead to a right way to get a perfect accuracy . Is that a bug or i missed something ?? Thanks for helping me .
